summary: This document appears to be an attachment to a petition for an advisory opinion regarding a trust agreement created by the Settlor. It outlines the terms of the trust, including the Settlor's rights to substitute property within the trust and the implications for tax purposes. The document discusses the legal framework governing the trust and the powers of the Settlor and Trustees.

persons.name: Settlor
persons.context: The Settlor is the individual who created the irrevocable trust and has specific powers regarding the trust property.

persons.name: Trustees
persons.context: The Trustees are responsible for managing the trust property and ensuring compliance with the terms of the Trust Agreement.

keyFacts: The Settlor created an irrevocable trust and is deemed to own the trust property for tax purposes.
The Settlor has the right to substitute trust property without the consent of the Trustees.
The document outlines the legal framework for the substitution of property within the trust.
The Settlor paid New York State sales tax on the substituted property.
Trustees may allow beneficiaries to use the substituted property without charge or consideration.
